# TIDAL Data Exploration


## Descriptive Statistics

Descriptive statistics of the variable "`r params$phenotype`" for each time point in your data.

```{r, echo=F, warning=F}

kable(params$descTable, digits = 3)
```

time_point: Time point of data collectio

N: Number of measurements (e.g. people) at each time point 

mean: Mean `r params$phenotype`

SD: standard deviation of `r params$phenotype` 

median: Median of `r params$phenotype` 

IQR: Interquartile range of `r params$phenotype`


## Model Results

`r params$modelType` model was run using [lme4](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lme4/index.html) with
`r params$formCode`. 

`r strsplit(params$warningMsg, " Please")[[1]][1]` For more information on lme4 optimisers, see [here](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lme4/vignettes/lmerperf.html). The use of alternative lme4 optimisers is currently not supported.

`r params$statement`

`r params$N`


## Plot

```{r, echo = F}
params$mainPlot
```

`r params$modelType` `r params$formCode`. "Phenotype" on the y-axis is `r params$phenotype`. Note covariates are not included in this plot (yet).



### Fixed Effects

Fixed effects can be interpreted as the effects of time/age (and any additional covariates) on `r params$phenotype`.

```{r, echo=F}
kable(params$fixedTab, digits = 3)
```



### Random Effects

Random effects can be interpreted as the effects on `r params$phenotype` due to variation between subjects.

```{r, echo=F}
kable(params$randomTab, digits = 3)
```
